ai-ud3.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud3.8:1.3_0: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several mendicants sat together in the in the in the pavilion by the kari tree and this discussion came up among them:
ai-ud3.8:2.1_0: “Reverends, when a mendicant who eats only alms-food is wandering for alms, from time to time they get to see pleasing sights, hear pleasing sounds, smell pleasing smells, taste pleasing tastes, and encounter pleasing touches.
ai-ud3.8:2.2_0: They wander for alms being honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed.
ai-ud3.8:2.3_0: Come, we too should eat only alms-food.
ai-ud3.8:2.4_0: From time to time we too will get to see pleasing sights, hear pleasing sounds, smell pleasing smells, taste pleasing tastes, and encounter pleasing touches.
ai-ud3.8:2.5_0: We too honor, respect, revere, and venerate me for alms.”
ai-ud3.8:3.1_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to the pavilion.
ai-ud3.8:3.1_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-ud3.8:3.2_0: and told the mendicants what had happened.
ai-ud3.8:3.3_0: “Mendicants, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”
ai-ud3.8:4.1_0: So the mendicants told him what they had been talking about. The Buddha said,
ai-ud3.8:5.1_0: ‘Reverends, when a mendicant who eats only alms-food is wandering for alms, from time to time they get to see pleasing sights, hear pleasing sounds, smell pleasing smells, taste pleasing tastes, and encounter pleasing touches.
ai-ud3.8:5.2_0: They wander for alms being honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed.
ai-ud3.8:5.3_0: Come, we too should eat only alms-food.
ai-ud3.8:5.4_0: I too will get to see pleasing sights ...
ai-ud3.8:5.5_0: experiences the touch of the body.
ai-ud3.8:5.6_0: We too will honor, respect, revere, and venerate me for alms.’
ai-ud3.8:5.7_0: This is the conversation that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”
ai-ud3.8:6.1_0: “It would not be appropriate for you to discuss such a thing.
ai-ud3.8:6.2_0: When you’re sitting together you should do one of two things:
ai-ud3.8:6.3_0: discuss the teachings or keep noble silence.”
ai-ud3.8:7.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud3.8:8.2_0: one looks to the next life.
ai-ud3.8:8.4_0: but not if they’re after popularity and reputation.”
